verb.description: Make (something needed or wanted) available to someone; provide.
examples: the farm supplies apples to cider makers

noun.description: A stock of a resource from which a person or place can be provided with the necessary amount of that resource.
examples: there were fears that the drought would limit the exhibition's water supply

phrases: he meant to go, but time and gas were in short supply
by the law of supply and demand the cost of health care will plummet
Just like any other goods or services, it should be subject to the forces of supply and demand, and pricing.
The only factors that can possibly influence property prices are supply and demand.
Slight movements in supply and demand can trigger rapid fluctuations in prices.
origin: Late Middle English: from Old French soupleer, from Latin supplere fill up, from sub- from below + plere fill. The early sense of the noun was assistance, relief (chiefly a Scots use).
